title: Dear type?
content:
Hi there—can anyone help identify this typeface. Many thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203175805im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/595105701_1_4440.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Plastique Magazine logo & titling face - H&FJ Akropolis, Rhode Cond {Yves, Hanno Bennert}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203175805/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38801 "Go to previous forum topic") [Need typeface asap!!! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203175805/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38815 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ult

comments.content: URW Craw Modern Regular Italic is very close, the sample is slightly more condensed

I think it is Miller Display Italic, but it looks like a mistake happened: The text was converted to outlines, then the outline was selected—except for the counter on the D—and moved to the right, leaving the counter of the D misaligned, which made the stems different widths.
